qas.question: Who was concerned with Russia  capturing Constantinople?
Who sent men to the Dardanelles?
As men were sent to the Dardanelles, where did Burgoyne go?
Who was Burgoyne visiting in Paris?

answers.text: British Ambassador and the French Emperor

qas.question: Who wrote to Burgoyne on February 8th?

context: <a0_0>Britain<a0_0/> was concerned about Russian activity and Sir John Burgoyne senior advisor to Lord Aberdeen urged that the Dardanelles should be occupied and throw up works of sufficient strength to block any Russian move to capture Constantinople and gain access to the Mediterranean Sea. <a1_0>The Corps of Royal Engineers<a1_0/> sent men to the Dardanelles while Burgoyne went to <a2_0>Paris<a2_0/>, meeting the <a3_0>British Ambassador and the French Emperor<a3_0/>. The <a4_0>Lord Cowley<a4_0/> wrote on 8 February to Burgoyne "Your visit to Paris has produced a visible change in the Emperor's views, and he is making every preparation for a land expedition in case the last attempt at negotiation should break down.":411
